title: Unity among Muslim countries imperative to resolve issues confronted by Muslim Ummah: NA speaker
content:
ISLAMABAD, Apr 13 (APP): Speaker of the National Assembly Raja Pervaiz Ashraf on Thursday said that unity among Islamic countries was imperative to resolve issues confronted by the Muslim Ummah.
During a meeting with Iran’s Ambassador to Pakistan Seyed Mohammad Ali, Raja Pervaiz Ashraf also discussed matters of mutual interest, including strengthening the bilateral cooperation in various fields, promoting regional peace and security, and enhancing trade and economic ties between Pakistan and Iran.
The Speaker congratulated Seyed Mohammad Ali on his successful diplomatic assignment in Pakistan and appreciated his contributions in further strengthening the brotherly ties between the two countries, said a news release.
He expressed gratitude to the Supreme Leader Ayatullah Ali Khamenei and President Raisi for their continued support to the Kashmir cause and assured Iran of Pakistan’s support on its core issues, including the JCPOA and human rights issues.
The speaker felicitated the Iranian Ambassador on the revival of Iran and Saudi Arab diplomatic relations. Underscoring Pakistan’s close fraternal relations with Iran and Saudi Arabia, he termed it as a positive step that would lead to improving regional peace and stability as well as increasing cooperation among Muslim countries to overcome the current challenges faced by Muslim Ummah.
The two sides reiterated their commitment to fighting terrorism, which poses a common threat to both Iran and Pakistan, through joint concerted efforts.
They also acknowledged the positive trajectory in bilateral relations, including enhanced engagement at multiple levels and frequent exchange of visits and telephone calls between the leadership on all matters of significance.
Both sides also agreed to hold an Iranian art/photo exhibition at the Parliament displaying rare manuscripts of Holy Quran and other sacred documents. The event would be in continuation of golden jubilee celebratory activities of the Constitution of the Islamic Republic of Pakistan passed in 1973.
The Speaker concluded by thanking Seyed Mohammad Ali for his productive and fruitful tenure in Pakistan and wished him all the best for his next diplomatic assignment.
